alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Lake; Newton; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 31 at 12:44PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Threat for River Ice Jams Continues Next Few Days... Very cold temperatures will continue today through Thursday, bringing favorable conditions for rapid river ice formation and ice jams. Many rivers in northern Illinois have already seen increases in ice concentration and a few minor ice jams. Although confidence in the exact timing and location of potential ice jams is low, temperatures and river levels will be consistent with past periods of time when ice jams have occurred. The highest threat of ice jams is on the Rock, Fox, and Kankakee rivers. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Persons along area rivers should closely monitor forecasts including the possibility of flood watches, warnings, and advisories. An update to this outlook is expected to be issued tomorrow.
